scenes.background: [Monica] raises an eyebrow after discussing the availability for urgent tasks.
scenes.description: Bob glances at you, tapping his pen. 'Are you sure you can handle urgent tasks during your breaks? What if it becomes too much?'

options.text: I think we should assess each situation individually to avoid overcommitting.
options.analysis: You show good self-regulation and emotional perception by suggesting a balanced approach, but the motivation to directly engage with the issue is lower.

options.text: I'll set boundaries but remain available for truly critical tasks.
options.analysis: You demonstrate responsibility and motivation but might compromise your self-regulation and empathy by overcommitting.

options.text: Maybe we need to redefine what constitutes an 'urgent' task.
options.analysis: You show empathy by seeking clarity but may come off as less proactive and socially skilled.
